headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Super Micro, Nvidia, Broadcom, Tesla, U.S. Steel, Netflix, and More
summary: Super Micro rises sharply, chip stocks Nvidia and Broadcom trade higher, and U.S. Steel gains even as Nippon Steel’s plan to acquire the U.S. steel company is referred to President Biden, who has opposed the deal.

headline: Broadcom Stock Is Having a Big Year. Here Are Some of the Highlights.
summary: Broadcom  may have had a volatile year, but the stock was rising on investor enthusiasm Tuesday as it headed for its best year on record.  The California-based tech company is known for making application-specific integrated circuits, or ASICs.  Broadcom  customers use these specially designed chips to power artificial intelligence.

headline: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: Tech Stocks Help Drive Christmas Eve Rally

headline: Biden administration announces new Chinese chips probe, Semiconductor stocks gain
summary: Investing.com -- U.S. semiconductor stocks mostly edged higher in premarket trading on Tuesday after the Biden administration launched a new trade investigation into Chinese-made legacy semiconductors.
